utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What are you drawing over there?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s a hypothetical containment field for a Frisbee-sized wormhole that could serve as a portal to a parallel universe.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, you silly doodlebug.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, a lot of scientists believe that making contact with other life-forms would probably not end well for us.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s a Frisbee-sized wormhole, Leonard. You can block it with a Frisbee. Calm down.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Do you expect me to build this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I expect you to wipe the pudding off your chin. Gentlemen.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Have you guys ever noticed that Sheldon always disappears every day at two forty-five?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He probably just goes to the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Actually, no, he goes to the bathroom at eight a.m. with optional follow-ups at one forty-five and seven ten high-fibre Fridays.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s sad that you know that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, that’s just the tip of the sadness iceberg.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m looking at his public calendar. Two forty-five to three-oh-five, nothing. Yesterday, two forty-five to three-oh-five, nothing, last week, nothing, last month, nothing. He never has anything booked during that time.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Twenty minutes a day, completely unaccounted for.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We should figure out where he goes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh, this is exciting. Like one of my classic murder mystery dinner parties.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right, the case of who murdered three Saturday nights of my life?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Colonel Koothrapali in the kitchen with the olive spread.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It was tapenade and you guys suck.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, how was work today?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, I spent most of the afternoon growing isotopically pure crystals for neutrino detection.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That sounds like fun.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, it was.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, good, I guessed right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Who you talking to?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, just this guy I met at school.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, great. We’re still dating, right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Relax. He’s just a friend. We’re doing an oral report together. He’s really nice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry, what was that? I had a little stroke after oral.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Would you stop? Look, he just moved here from London, okay? He doesn’t really know anybody.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, good, an English accent, the sexiest accent you can have.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. That’s not true. There’s French, there’s Italian. No, you’re right, it’s the best.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did you tell him you have a boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It didn’t come up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, maybe you should tell him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What am I supposed to say?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Say, can’t talk right now, hanging with my boyfriend. England sucks, you suck, USA number one.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine. Hanging with my boyfriend. Talk to you later. Happy?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What did he say?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Did your boyfriend make you type that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I hate this guy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Don’t be like that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, trust me, he’s hitting on you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, he’s not. We’re just friends. Look, is this gonna be a problem? Because he’s supposed to come over tomorrow to work.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? Here?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: If it makes you uncomfortable, I’ll switch partners, even though the thing’s due next week and everyone already has a partner and I’ll probably end up failing the class.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’d be great. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Two forty-four, Right on schedule. Hey, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, hello.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Raj and I are heading over to the genetics lab to pet the glow-in-the-dark bunny. Want to come with us?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you sure? They turn off the lights, and it’s like a cute little laser show that poops all over the place.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m quite sure. Good day.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We just told you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I just told you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, you didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, it’s your word against mine; see you in court.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Should we follow him?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t know, I’m torn. I want to know where he’s going, but now I kind of want to play with the bunny.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Hi, guys.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Alex, do you know where your boss just went?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t you know his schedule?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: All I know is corduroy makes too much noise and I have to go find quieter pants.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Boy, what I wouldn’t give to get her out of those pants and into something a little more stylish.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: This is where he goes? What’s in there?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I think it’s an old storage room.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What could he be doing in there every day for twenty minutes?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, he’s not doing twenty-minute abs, because if he were, he would have way better abs. Can you hear anything?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not yet. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m listening.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Can’t you face the other way and listen?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I can’t do anything right for you, can I?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What the hell is he up to?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He is kind of a weirdo. Maybe he’s got Leonard Nimoy chained up in there. Or Bill Gates. Or Stephen Hawking.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why would he chain up Stephen Hawking?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Howard, please, you can’t treat the man differently just because he’s disabled. That’s not okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If you’re wondering why I’ve been staring through the peephole, I’m trying to get a look at this guy who’s coming over to Penny’s.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: To be honest, I didn’t know you were here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not a big deal. He’s just in her history class. They’re working on a project together. I don’t even know why I care. You know what, I don’t care.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You think you don’t care?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This is silly. I have nothing to worry about.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. I mean, statistically speaking, I’m sure you have something to worry about.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, if we assume your looks are average, yeah, right off the bat, fifty percent of men on Earth are more attractive than you. That’s one point five billion handsome lads standing by, waiting to rain on your parade.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, yeah, but this isn’t just about looks. I’m, I’m way above average in a lot of other things.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not height, vision, athleticism, or ability to digest dairy products.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m talking about important things like emotional maturity.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You were just spying on your girlfriend through a peephole.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I liked it better when you thought I wasn’t here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not saying you don’t have attractive qualities. Your choice of friends is impeccable, you’re a good sleeper, and last but not least, you buy the grapes I like. You’re a real catch compared to some snoring guy with a fridge full of lousy grapes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: None of this matters. I trust that Penny cares about me, and nothing’s gonna happen with this guy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, unless of course he’s a skilled hypnotist.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: While unlikely, it’s still a statistical possibility. She might be performing sexual acts with him and not even know it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Now you’re just being ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Am I? The mind’s a mysterious thing, Leonard. He could be having the time of his life while she thinks she’s a chicken pecking for corn.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Look at us, sneaking around in the middle of the night like a couple of cat burglars.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I think we’re more like ninjas.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t want to be a ninja, I want to be a cat burglar.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine, I’ll be a ninja, you be a cat burglar.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, we both have to be the same thing. Okay, we’re ninjas.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But next time, we’ll be cat burglars.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s locked.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, I’m sure. Now, you stand guard, I’m going to…

utterance.speaker: Raj (trying door)
utterance.content: It’s locked.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Just keep an eye out. I’ll have this open in a minute.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: When did you learn how to pick locks?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: When I was starting to do magic in junior high, I thought I could be an escape artist like Harry Houdini.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How did that work out?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Pretty good. I managed to escape friends, popularity, and every party thrown in a twelve mile radius. There. Ready?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hold on, hold on.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sheldon is a very smart man, and he obviously wants to keep this a secret.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, so?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What if it’s booby-trapped?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t worry, I’m one step ahead of him.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Great, what’s your pl…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Are we good?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah. Huh. Forty-three? What the hell does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know. The solution to an equation?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe. It’s a prime number. Encryption systems are built on prime numbers.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What kind of secret does Sheldon have to encrypt?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He’s always been very cagey about what he puts in his egg salad to make it so tasty.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s paprika.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Really? Well, oh, okay, one mystery solved.

utterance.speaker: Voice from Outside
utterance.content: Okay, good night.

utterance.speaker: Penny (off)
utterance.content: Thanks, Cole. See you at school.

utterance.speaker: Cole (off)
utterance.content: See you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ll be right back.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I thought you left a long time ago.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (rushing to catch up with Cole)
utterance.content: ‘sup?

utterance.speaker: Cole
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You, uh, moving into the apartment on the fifth floor?

utterance.speaker: Cole
utterance.content: No, I was just visiting a friend.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, cool. That cute blonde on four?

utterance.speaker: Cole
utterance.content: Yeah. You know her?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I, well, I see her around. I like to keep my distance because her boyfriend is a pretty scary dude.

utterance.speaker: Cole
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. He’s ganged up.

utterance.speaker: Cole
utterance.content: She told me he’s a scientist.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s the name of his gang. The Scientists. They are crazy.

utterance.speaker: Cole
utterance.content: Well, thanks for the tip.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No problem, brother. Stay frosty. We’re still dating, right?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Oh, hello, Dr. Hofstadter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Alex, and call me Leonard. Dr. Hofstadter is my father. And my mother. And my sister. And our cat. Although, I’m pretty sure Dr. Boots Hofstadter’s degree was honorary.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: May I join you, Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Alex, let me ask you something. My girlfriend knows this guy at school. He’s got an English accent.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Ooh, I love English accents.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, you all do. Anyway, I feel like he’s hitting on her. She says he’s just being nice and that I should trust her.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: It’s probably harmless. You know how it is. I’m sure you get hit on all the time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right. Because girls are always like, ooh, that guy owns two Star Trek uniforms and gets a lot of ear infections. I got to get me some of that.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: I don’t know, I bet it happens more than you realize.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Trust me, it doesn’t.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: You sure? You’re cute, you’re funny. Maybe you’re getting hit on, and you don’t even know it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Yep, pretty sure.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (laughs)
utterance.content: Okay, I got to get back to work. Thanks for listening.

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: No problem.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hope-hope no girls rip my clothes off on the way.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on, we’re smart guys. We can figure this out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Forty-three. What is forty-three? Besides my mom’s neck size.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s the atomic number for technetium.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That stuff’s radioactive.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Do you think he’s building a bomb?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ah, it took him two years to put together that Lego Death Star, I’m not worried.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh, this could be something. forty-three is the number of calories in half a cup of fat-free yoghurt.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why would you know that?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m sorry. We can’t all eat whatever we want and still stay thin. Wait, in the Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy, isn’t forty-three the answer to the question of life, the universe,and everything?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s forty-two, dumb-ass.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, hey. Feelings.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We should stop. I’m exhausted.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, me, too. We’ve got more important things to do. Who cares what stupid forty-three means?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Let’s go home. You want to get something to eat?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sounds good.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What the balls is forty-three?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I have to know!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, shouldn’t you be out with your gang, spray painting equations on the side of buildings?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I just can’t believe you don’t trust me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I do, of course I do.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Then why did you embarrass me in front of my friend, who, by the way, knew exactly who you were?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Your picture’s on my refrigerator.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. You know, I’m really starting to not like this guy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What is your problem? Do you use up all your thinking at work and then have none left over for when you get home?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. It-it-it’s hard sometimes. Everywhere you go, guys hit on you, even if I’m standing right there. And they’re all taller than me. Why is everyone taller than me? You know what, this is all in my head. It’s my problem, not yours.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, why do you always do this? Listen to me, you’re the one I’m with. You know I love you, so will you please relax because you’re driving me crazy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know that’s the first time you ever said that you love me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re just supposed to pretend it’s not a big deal?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s exactly what we’re gonna do because you’re about to make me cry, and we both know if I start crying, you’re gonna start crying.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re right, you should go.

utterance.speaker: Penny (crying)
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (crying)
utterance.content: She loves me. Hey, it’s Alex. Nice having coffee with you. If you want to talk more, I’m always available. Smiley face, smiley face. What a friendly girl.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, picture’s up. Looks like the camera’s working.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s good quality video.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It better be. It’s the spare camera for the Mars rover.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How did you get your hands on that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Million dollar camera, ten dollar lock.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, my God, here he comes. This is it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What the hell is that thing?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (on screen)
utterance.content: This is Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Experimental log. Wormhole generator test forty-four.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wormhole generator test?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The first forty-three parallel universes I’ve checked proved to be empty. I see no reason to suspect universe number forty-four will be any different.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, my God!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Holy crap!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (with an alien creature stuck to his face)
utterance.content: Oh! It’s eating my face!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Aah! It’s eating his face!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (throwing alien onto the laptop)
utterance.content: I found your webcam and replaced the video feed. You two should be ashamed of yourselves.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sheldon, we’re really sorry.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, really sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sorry? You may not realize it, but I have difficulty navigating certain aspects of daily life. You know, understanding sarcasm, feigning interest in others, not talking about trains as much as I want to. It’s exhausting. Which is why, for twenty minutes a day, I like to go down to that room, turn my mind off and do what I need to do to recharge.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: But what are you doing in there?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And what does forty-three mean?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You don’t need to know, you don’t deserve to know, and you will never know.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I know how to make your egg salad now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight… Drat. I’m never going to get to forty-three again. One, two, three, four… Rats.
